intro: Genista sennenii, commonly known as the Spanish broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments, such as rocky soils and coastal areas. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
